{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3485546,"name":"Harrison","username":"hjmcphail76","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hjmcphail76/{size}/234713_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T13:50:14.092Z","cooked":"

In this image, would you use steel or aluminum rivets for connecting the plate to the elevator (not the drivebase, we will use bolts for modularity.) The plate is 1/4in plate and the tubing is 1/8 wall.

image866×652 190 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T13:50:14.092Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":295,"readers_count":294,"score":144.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Harrison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3485573,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T14:25:24.683Z","cooked":"

Depends… Are you pulling these by hand or do you have a powertool?

Aluminum is a no brainer if by hand.

Even with a power tool I would probably use aluminum.

This looks like a support brace, ultimately you probably don’t even need that many rivets to do the job.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T14:27:34.290Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":244,"readers_count":243,"score":58.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/2","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485575,"name":"Harrison","username":"hjmcphail76","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hjmcphail76/{size}/234713_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T14:27:44.161Z","cooked":"

We have the hand tool, but we could get the power tool if it is recommended or makes a difference? We usually don’t use rivets so I do not know much.

Also, the vertical one is a brace but the angled one is the Thrifty Elevator

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T14:28:20.277Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":87.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Harrison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485578,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T14:30:29.162Z","cooked":"

Hand tool is fine.

Use aluminum.

  • Think about order of operations, working in tight spaces sucks.
  • Make sure everything is riveted together nice and flat (use clamps if you have them)
  • Surfaces are clean from chips/dust, the rivets are fully seated (put the rivet in the tool, through the hole, and tap the back of the tool lightly with a hammer)
  • Try not to wiggle the tool too much when pulling the rivet.
","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T14:33:09.999Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":192,"readers_count":191,"score":138.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57833,"username":"hjmcphail76","name":"Harrison","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hjmcphail76/{size}/234713_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/5","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485586,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T14:37:13.291Z","cooked":"

If you don’t have a good way to put external clamps on, consider using a Cleco kit.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T14:37:13.291Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":59.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/Cleco-Fastener-Starter-Kit-Fasteners/dp/B08VRQSF6Y","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Cleco Fastener Starter Kit - Cleco Fasteners, Clamps, and Pliers - Amazon.com","clicks":22}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/6","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485587,"name":"Harrison","username":"hjmcphail76","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hjmcphail76/{size}/234713_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T14:38:32.379Z","cooked":"

We already bought and have those, and will be using them for alignment and then clamps as well for larger parts.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T14:38:32.379Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":165,"readers_count":164,"score":88.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Harrison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66298,"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485603,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T14:50:46.822Z","cooked":"

With the leverage the elevator tubes will have, it is likely that aluminum rivets will rip out of the holes in the tubes, so steel rivets won’t give you any advantage and will be more difficult to install. They will also be more difficult to remove, when a mistake is made or repairs are necessary.

Aluminum rivets are available with aluminum mandrels as well as steel mandrels. The ones with steel mandrels will require a bit more force on a hand tool.

Oh yes. It looks like you all applied for your team just before we did.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T14:51:56.058Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":60.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485611,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T14:55:17.043Z","cooked":"

Oh yeah that’s a good point.

I personally prefer steel mandrels on aluminum rivets, I find they generally seat better, are more consistent, and they should provide more holding force. However, I have powertools, they are definitely doable by hand, I just wouldn’t want to do 50 of them.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T14:56:03.646Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":130,"readers_count":129,"score":106.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":15467,"username":"philso","name":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/9","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485613,"name":"Harrison","username":"hjmcphail76","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hjmcphail76/{size}/234713_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T14:57:18.726Z","cooked":"
philso:

Oh yes. It looks like you all applied for your team just before we did

Lol yeah, that’s pretty cool.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T14:57:18.726Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":39.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Harrison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485616,"name":"Harrison","username":"hjmcphail76","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hjmcphail76/{size}/234713_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T14:58:45.938Z","cooked":"

So would the rivets with steel mandrels rip out of the tubing with enough quantity to distribute the load? Or should we consider something else.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T14:58:45.938Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":37.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Harrison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485629,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T15:07:11.393Z","cooked":"

Half a dozen rivets should be fine on each side of the connection unless you are using the elevator to climb, then double it if you can.

Make sure you are using an appropriate length rivet.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T15:07:32.523Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":99,"readers_count":98,"score":39.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57833,"username":"hjmcphail76","name":"Harrison","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hjmcphail76/{size}/234713_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/12","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485683,"name":"Harrison","username":"hjmcphail76","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hjmcphail76/{size}/234713_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T16:14:59.716Z","cooked":"

Half a dozen all aluminum or half a dozen aluminum with steel mandrel?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T16:14:59.716Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":24.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482270,"topic_slug":"fastener-decision","display_username":"Harrison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/fastener-decision/482270/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485688,"name":"Devin Castellucci","username":"RoboChair","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/robochair/{size}/161076_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T16:22:55.717Z","cooked":"

You can also look at High Strength Rivets. Or as I sometimes like to refer to them, Instant Bolts!
They are not cheap for what they are, but they are wildly more durable than typical aluminum rivets.
McMaster-Carr for reference.

Ok thanks, I don’t know why I couldn’t find that. We usually don’t do rivets (and I am mainly a programmer) so we just want to make sure we get the right thing.

How critical is it for the hole to be drilled out with the #11 drill bit? MAXtube holes are 5mm and the custom laser cut parts are around that as well (not sure the about tolerance, usually cuts a little undersized for holes so we will see.)

These look awesome, thx for the tip.

off topic:

They look reasonably water tight too, so may not be a bad choice for some sail boat stuff (masts filling with water sucks) and other solutions require oversized holes and/or are pricey for the good stuff.
